context: The Estonian word 'halb' is an adjective that means bad, poor, or inferior. It's the antonym of 'hea' (good). The word can be used to describe various negative qualities - physical conditions like vision or hearing, skills or abilities (bad at drawing), moral character (bad person), quality of items (bad food), situations (bad weather), or general negativity (bad mood). It has comparative forms like 'halvem' (worse) and superlative forms like 'halvim' (worst). The word can also have historical usage meaning cheap or inexpensive.
